thread.title: Strike action: 'Extensive disruption' as huge number of Dublin Bus and train services cancelled
thread.title_full: Strike action: 'Extensive disruption' as huge number of Dublin Bus and train services cancelled

title: Strike action: 'Extensive disruption' as huge number of Dublin Bus and train services cancelled
text:
Strike action: 'Extensive disruption' as huge number of Dublin Bus and train services cancelled Independent.ie Rail passengers have been warned of major disruption to trains and DARTs this morning due to secondary picketing relating to the Bus Eireann strike. http://www.independent.ie/irish-news/strike-action-extensive-disruption-as-huge-number-of-dublin-bus-and-train-services-cancelled-35581629.html http://www.independent.ie/incoming/article35581638.ece/9f34c/AUTOCROP/h342/BusEireann.jpg 
Rail passengers have been warned of major disruption to trains and DARTs this morning due to secondary picketing relating to the Bus Eireann strike. 
The strike which has been running for a week today is set to run indefinitely and Bus Éireann workers strike at Broadstone bus depot on Friday March 24 Pic:Mark Condren 
In a statement Irish Rail warned of cancellations across DART, Commuter and Intercity services. 
"We cannot guarantee any services across DART and Dublin Commuter services, and cancellations on Intercity routes are also expected," the company said. Update: Major Disruption to services due to Bus Éireann dispute, please see service details here https://t.co/rukH7fiLOU — Iarnród Éireann (@IrishRail) March 31, 2017 
Dublin Bus services are also to be hit with the company advising of "serious disruption" due to picketing at depots. 
There will be an "extremely limited" services on DART in the capital with only the 5.40am Bray to Malahide, 6.00am Greystones to Malahide running. On the Malahide to Bray line only the 7.00am and 7.30am services will run. 
Intercity services including Westport to Dublin, Cork to Dublin and Maynooth/M3 services have been cancelled. 
The company is awaiting confirmation on a number of routes and will be updating customers via their Twitter account and website throughout the morning. 
Last night secretary of the National Bus and Rail Union warned that that the union was finding it increasingly difficult to "hold the line with regards to preventing contagion across the entire public transport sector". 
"Te NBRU has been warning of the potential for this strike to spill over well in advance of its commencement, it is becoming increasingly clear that the continuous build-up of frustration and pressure among our members is reaching volcanic proportions and may, despite our urgings to the contrary, erupt into the mother of all public transport disputes," he said. Irish Rail update 6am 
The dispute concerns cost-cutting plans at the bus company. 
The strike has been costing the company an estimated €500,000 per day and is set to continue indefinitely. 06:30 Galway Heuston will operate — Iarnród Éireann (@IrishRail) March 31, 2017 All DART services cancelled except 07.00 Malahide to Bray — Iarnród Éireann (@IrishRail) March 31, 2017 All Maynooth/M3 services cancelled. Morning commuter services from Drogheda and Dundalk TO Dublin still running. — Iarnród Éireann (@IrishRail) March 31, 2017 All Portlaoise/Kildare/Newbridge to Heuston/GCD cancelled except 06.35 Kildare to Heuston — Iarnród Éireann (@IrishRail) March 31, 2017 All trains to/from Cork and Kerry cancelled, including Cork Commuter services — Iarnród Éireann (@IrishRail) March 31, 2017 05.30 and 06.30 Galway to Heuston are running. Limited service betwee Galway and Heuston expected to continue — Iarnród Éireann (@IrishRail) March 31, 2017 05.40 and 06.15 Longford to Dublin cancelled. 05.45 Sligo to Dublin is running — Iarnród Éireann (@IrishRail) March 31, 2017 05.40 and 06.15 Longford to Dublin cancelled. 05.45 Sligo to Dublin is running — Iarnród Éireann (@IrishRail) March 31, 2017 All Westport/Dublin cancelled. 05.20 and 07.00 Athlone to Dublin cancelled. — Iarnród Éireann (@IrishRail) March 31, 2017 Correction - Waterford services cancelled except 06.00 Waterford to Heuston. 06.30 from Carlow also cancelled — Iarnród Éireann (@IrishRail) March 31, 2017 
Separately, a breakdown in the southbound bore of the Port Tunnel is also adding to traffic delays for Dublin commuters this morning. 
More to follow
